page.title: 06SWADLINCOTE POTTERIES.
page.content: {Potteries}began here around 1790 and that industry specialised in producing fireclay products for the iron & steel industry.Although there have been many changes of ownership that first busi- ness still exists today in the form of {Thomas Wragg & Sons.}Several other potteries were established in the first quarter of the 19th Century,most of them specialising in domestic stoneware.No business was very large, the biggest having 6 kilns,& others only 2 or 3. {The Public Health Act of 1875}encour- aged many firms to switch to drainpipe & sanitary ware in a boom which went on into the 20th. Century. With much of the local clay now worked out the potteries continue to flourish though fewer in number, specialising in drainpipes and domestic stoneware.
